title: Little known French connection and the battle of Trinco
snippet: The narrow strip of shallow lagoon between Great Sober Island and the mainland was known as 'French Pass' to signify the battle of Trincomalee. Some local naval historians say that it was called 'French Fast' as many French sailors had died of starvation on this 75-acre island.
